Key Arguments: Science and medicine are constantly evolving, and there should be room for transparent debate rather than dogma.
The proposed legislation contradicts the MEAA Journalists Code of Ethics.
The principles of informed consent are compromised by the legislation.
The legislation undermines democratic principles by limiting diverse viewpoints.
Past definitions of misinformation and disinformation have had harmful consequences.
Notable Quotes: No one entity, individual or Government should be the sole authority on any truth.
The last three years has seen an extraordinary departure from adherence to these journalism ethics.
If this bill passes, misinformation/disinformation will constitute anything not approved or agreed upon by the Government of the day.
The consequences of its passing will be an assault on all of us for generations to come.
